citation.article-title: Acidiplasma aeolicum gen. nov., sp. nov., a euryarchaeon of the family Ferroplasmaceae isolated from a hydrothermal pool, and transfer of Ferroplasma cupricumulans to Acidiplasma cupricumulans comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Acidiplasma (A.ci.di.plas′ma. N.L. neut. n acidum an acid; Gr. neut. n. plasma something shaped or moulded; N.L. neut. n. Acidiplasma an acid-living form).
Cells are irregular cocci, varying from spherical to filamentous.
Oxidize ferrous iron in the presence of trace amounts of yeast extract.
16S rRNA gene sequences group within the family Ferroplasmaceae, in the order Thermoplasmatales, phylum Euryarchaeota.
Known habitats are hydrothermal pools and chalcocite-containing sulfide ores.
The type species is Acidiplasma aeolicum.
